poem:
"Harlech Impressions"

Amidst Gwynedd's silent breadth,
Harlech Castle shrinks,
under leaden Welsh skies. 
Drizzle baptizes old stones, 
anointing the hills' echoing drama.
Days lengthen and invite, yet
remain shrouded in drizzle's grey mystery. 
Even grandest structures bow low,
to the might of the landscape.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Country diary: Even castles can look reduced in the drama of this landscape | John Gilbey The longer days are tempting me further from home, so on the first morning with no forecast rain I head north into the county of Gwynedd. Skirting the estuaries of the Dyfi and the Mawddach, I pitch up at Harlech just as a light drizzle begins to fall. From the old shoreline, the great bulk of Harlech Castle and the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
